name: Starter Pack
description: A few simple recipes to get you started on your culinary journey.

recipes.title: Simple Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Whisk eggs and milk together in a bowl.
Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour in the egg mixture and cook, stirring gently, until cooked to your liking.

recipes.title: Classic Grilled Cheese
recipes.summary: A golden, cheesy, and comforting classic.
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place one slice, butter-side down, in a skillet over medium heat.
Top with cheese, then the other slice of bread, butter-side up.
Grill for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and the cheese is melted.

recipes.title: Quick Chicken Quesadilla
instructions: Place tortilla in a skillet over medium heat.
Sprinkle chicken and cheese over one half of the tortilla.
Fold the other half over and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden and cheese is melted.

recipes.title: One-Pan Lemon Herb Salmon
recipes.summary: A healthy and flavorful salmon dish with minimal cleanup.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, herbs, and lemon juice.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.

recipes.title: Simple Tomato Soup
recipes.summary: Classic, creamy tomato soup from canned tomatoes.
instructions: Combine crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth in a pot.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook for 15 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Basic Pasta with Garlic and Oil
recipes.summary: A simple yet delicious Italian pasta dish.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until garlic is golden.
Drain pasta, reserving some pasta water. Toss pasta with the garlic oil, adding a splash of pasta water to create a sauce.

recipes.title: Pan-Seared Steak
recipes.summary: A perfectly cooked steak with a beautiful crust.
instructions: Pat steak dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat a skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the steak and sear for 3-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
In the last minute of cooking, add butter and garlic to the pan and baste the steak.
Let the steak rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
